page.title: 12MOUNTAIN RESCUE SERVICES
page.content: This whole area falls under the aegis of the mid-Pennine Accident Panel, with the local Bolton Mountain Rescue Division, comprising some 33 members. This is a voluntary self-funding organisation, though the Police do supply them with radio equipment. A team of 15 can be called out at any time to assist in rescue operations, such as lost hikers caught out in adverse weather conditions on the moors or people who have fallen down a disused mine shaft. There have also been plane crashes to be located. On average they attend two or three calls per year.
